posts.post_content:
This is exactly the type of card that is great but won't see a ban in eternal formats, namely Modern, where it just co-won a couple Grand Prix. This is the type of card that can only be truly obsoleted with better counter spells or removal, and even then will see tons of play. Unfortunately, I think this card is here to stay for a while and no matter the removal printed in the near future, will be a relevant factor capable of winning games alongside a few weenies.  
  
Also, this followed up by [Loxodon Smiter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Loxodon Smiter) and then [Wilt-Leaf Liege](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wilt-Leaf Liege) should drastically diminish any chance of winning a control player had.

Unfortunately, I think this card is here to stay for a while and no matter the removal printed in the near future, will be a relevant factor capable of winning games alongside a few weenies.

Also, this followed up by Loxodon Smiter and then Wilt-Leaf Liege should drastically diminish any chance of winning a control player had.

posts.post_content:
Modern ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol) is blowing up to some ridiculous powerlevel lately;   
From the [one-drop](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=289226), over [that gal with her pony](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=243416) or [lil' toots here](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=290543) up to the [populatable 4 mana 5/5 with flash and trample](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=369036).  
  
But yeah.  
On my cap, this moose here earns the title big cheese of cheesiness by a quite a bit.  
Feel free to put some effort into counters and instant-speed point removal - even if you swing for the board swipe you hand me a [Scion of Wilderness](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Scion of Wilderness) that I can populate my field with - all as an extra for a 2 mana 2/2.  
  
  
And no, mdawk567, a \*/\* on creatures on my board is typically not gonna stop growing at 3/3 in a ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol) aggro and token populate pile.  
Toss your [Supreme Verdict](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Supreme Verdict) at me if you must, my [Loxodon Hierarch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Loxodon Hierarch) was trained just for the case [Gaddock/autocard](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gaddock/autocard)... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
Grand Abolisher outright said "No you can't cast spells on my turn" and had the added "Also your creatures, artifacts, and enchantments can't activate abilities either" and only saw play in certain aggro decks.  
  
VoR has a punisher mechanic, which means that players will either:  
  
A. Ignore it because they don't care about the tokens, in which case grats on your grizzly bears for GW  
B. Not play instants because they can't deal with the tokens right now, in which case it's just Grand Abolisher  
  
Granted, the death trigger is better than Abolisher's wider range of hate, but with the punisher mechanic it's certainly not significantly better than Grand Abolisher was and the tokens still die to Supreme Verdict. Also unless your board is really big, the token will not be bigger than a 3/3, in which case your 2/2 VoR became a 3/3 token, so grats on your GW haste-less strangleroot geist.   
  
The only real reason why this card is still so expensive is that there's basically no supply at all. No one ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
Grand Abolisher outright said "No you can't cast spells on my turn" and had the added "Also your creatures, artifacts, and enchantments can't activate abilities either" and only saw play in certain aggro decks.

VoR has a punisher mechanic, which means that players will either:

A. Ignore it because they don't care about the tokens, in which case grats on your grizzly bears for GW
B. Not play instants because they can't deal with the tokens right now, in which case it's just Grand Abolisher

Granted, the death trigger is better than Abolisher's wider range of hate, but with the punisher mechanic it's certainly not significantly better than Grand Abolisher was and the tokens still die to Supreme Verdict. Also unless your board is really big, the token will not be bigger than a 3/3, in which case your 2/2 VoR became a 3/3 token, so grats on your GW haste-less strangleroot geist.

The only real reason why this card is still so expensive is that there's basically no supply at all. No one ... (see all)

posts.post_content: Look guys -- this card is great, period. By that I mean, incredibly useful without being utterly broken. There is NO reason for anyone to whine about this card being unfair or about "control Magic sucking right now" when there are *regularly* Esper control decks top-8'ing in Standard at the moment. There are a million ways to get rid of this card altogether, and a million ways to board wipe ALL creatures, or quickly and easily get rid of ALL your tokens (i.e. [Ratchet Bomb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ratchet Bomb)). Don't hate because it's part of a deck type you don't prefer to play.
posts.html:
Look guys -- this card is great, period. By that I mean, incredibly useful without being utterly broken. There is NO reason for anyone to whine about this card being unfair or about "control Magic sucking right now" when there are regularly Esper control decks top-8'ing in Standard at the moment. There are a million ways to get rid of this card altogether, and a million ways to board wipe ALL creatures, or quickly and easily get rid of ALL your tokens (i.e. Ratchet Bomb). Don't hate because it's part of a deck type you don't prefer to play.

posts.post_content: Hey mdakw576... There is this thing WG has called populate. Ever heard of it? No? It's this neat little thing that lets you take ANY creature token, for example, that convenient little wayfaring temple elemental token left behind by that 2 drop up there... and makes a copy of it. So, in other words, you can constantly replicate your wayfaring temples. Lets see grand abolisher do that.
